definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: Mather attributes this type of intelligence to the octopuses' dangerous habitats.
sentences.chinese: 玛瑟将这类智慧归因于章鱼危机四伏的生活环境。

sentences.english: We are meeting at a time of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 我们在危机四伏之际汇聚在一起。

sentences.english: But a crisis took office, as if someone was in preventing the continue to conduct.
sentences.chinese: 但是一上任便危机四伏，似乎有人在阻止查案的继续。

sentences.english: Overload and overspeed, threatened by growing crises.
Baikonur lies by the 16)Syrdarya River, dangerously close to the 17)Aral Sea.
sentences.chinese: 拜科努尔位于锡尔河畔，靠近咸海，危机四伏。

sentences.english: But it's safe and there's no need to feel unsafe.
sentences.chinese: 但是这里很安全，没必要感到危机四伏。

sentences.english: Faced with the circumstance in which everything was at crisis, he had no other choice but do that.
sentences.chinese: 面对当时危机四伏的情况，他做出的选择实属无奈。

definition: at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
lit. as if walking on thin ice (idiom)/fig. to be extremely cautious/to be skating on thin ice
in (some place)/to be in (adversity, a difficult situation, danger, turmoil etc)/to find oneself in/placed in/surrounded by
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
